"}, {"question": "Can industrial workers appeal against the decision of the Labour Welfare Board regarding their application for financial assistance? ", "answer": "Yes, industrial workers have the right to appeal against the decision of the Labour Welfare Board by following the specified grievance redressal procedure outlined in the scheme. 

"}, {"question": "Are there any penalties for fraudulent claims or misuse of the scheme? ", "answer": "Industrial workers found guilty of making fraudulent claims or misusing the scheme may face penalties such as disqualification from future benefits or legal action, as per the provisions of the Goa, Daman and Diu Labour Welfare Fund Act, 1986.

"}, {"question": "What types of spectacles are covered under the scheme? ", "answer": "The scheme covers the cost of frames and lenses needed for corrective vision, up to the specified reimbursement limit, provided they are prescribed by a qualified optician or medical officer. 

"}, {"question": "Can industrial workers choose any optician or hospital for getting their eyes tested under the scheme? ", "answer": "Industrial workers can get their eyes tested at State Hospitals, Goa Medical College, or from a qualified optician recognized by the scheme.
